intro: Isolobus ecklonianus, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Isolobus ecklonianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
